creator: softspt@gchq.gsi.gov.uk
text:
The existing util_ldap.c considers it an error in util_ldap_cache_checkuserid 
if it searches for a user and gets back more than one entry. It could instead 
loop on the variable 'entry', using both ldap_first_entry and ldap_next_entry, 
to try binding to each entry in turn. I've made the change, and it seems to 
work fine - is there any particular problem with doing this?

(I'm ignoring the question of whether there *should* be non-unique entries in a 
directory server - I have to deal with a directory server that has them, 
whether I like it or not :-)

creator: minfrin@sharp.fm
text:
My feeling is that there should be unique entries for each user, as without this
there is no way for an administrator to know which of the entries actually
logged in. The only differentiator would be the password, which isn't logged
anywhere. :(

creator: softspt@gchq.gsi.gov.uk
text:
The DN would still be unique - it's only the user-id (the name entered by the 
user) that's not. Perhaps it could be an option, off by default?
